title: What is your typing technique? - Quora

response.answer_text: I never bothered to properly acclimate myself to formal typing practices (ie fingers positioned on home row) with QWERTY. So my typing ended up being a more chaotic hunt and peck with an evolved sot of ‘macro burst’ combinations- particular sequences of letters I found myself typing often I could bang out with lightning speed. As such, familiar content (scripts, programs, writing on familiar things) would be easier and quicker to type out. When I learned the Dvorak layout, I made an attempt to learn more formal typing practices. I wouldn’t say I did so to 100%. And as I maintained a fluency with QWERTY, I’ve sort of merged the two approaches. My hands are more consistently positioned; I don’t have to look at the keyboard when I’m on a productive tear, and yet there are still some ‘macro bursts’ when I encounter familiar sequences of symbols to type. It certainly works for me, and while I would never consider myself any sort of world class speed typer, I can out-type and out-produce so many I find myself in the company of, so it certainly works well enough for me to accomplish all I need to do and not have my typing speed or accuracy be any sort of productive liability for me.
